bug.author: XiaochenCui
bug.summary: Performance improvement very slightly through cache
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.1.1 Describe the bug I mount a hdfs folder to a alluxio, and read it directly, and than use cache, but the performance improvement are very slightly. Client: python-client <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio-py>https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio-py</denchmark-link>
Mount: <denchmark-code>[root@cdh1 alluxio]# alluxio fs mount hdfs://cdh1:8020/data/apps/hbase/data/data/default on /mnt/hdfs (hdfs, capacity=28.20TB, used=-1B(0%), not read-only, not shared, properties={}) hdfs://cdh1:8020/alluxio/root on / (hdfs, capacity=28.20TB, used=-1B(0%), not read-only, not shared, properties={}) </denchmark-code>
Read path: /mnt/hdfs/alert_record Script output: directly: <denchmark-code>[root@cdh1 alluxio]# alluxio fs free / / was successfully freed from Alluxio space. [root@cdh1 alluxio]# ./test.sh read /mnt/hdfs/alert_record /mnt/hdfs/alert_record file count: 5 read time: 0.565490007401 read size (bytes): 105590218.0 read size (kb): 103115.447266 read size (mb): 100.69867897 read size (gb): 0.098338553682 read speed(bytes/s): 186723402.037 read speed(kb/s): 182347.072302 read speed(mb/s): 178.073312795 read speed(gb/s): 0.173899719526 </denchmark-code>
cached: <denchmark-code>[root@cdh1 alluxio]# ./test.sh read /mnt/hdfs/alert_record /mnt/hdfs/alert_record file count: 5 read time: 0.483547925949 read size (bytes): 105590218.0 read size (kb): 103115.447266 read size (mb): 100.69867897 read size (gb): 0.098338553682 read speed(bytes/s): 218365569.023 read speed(kb/s): 213247.625999 read speed(mb/s): 208.249634765 read speed(gb/s): 0.20336878395 </denchmark-code>
The speed of read directly is 178mb/s and 208mb/s through cache. It's run on physical machine, not the cloud server or vm. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior I hope the performance is greatly improved. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.
